We can't wait to get the Do Epic Happy 2018 Planner in your hands.Share and follow us.www.facebook.com/doepiccomwww.twitter.com/doepiccomwww.instagram.com/doepiccomABOUT THE BRAND.PAPER LIBERTY LTD is a multi-channel lifestyle brand, specialising in print and printable personalised designs, stylish gifts, stationery and organising tools. PAPER LIBERTY LTD strives to create inspirational and stylish designs that can be treasured as a keepsake forever. Risks and challengesFrom our industry experience in graphic design, typography and print, we consider the risks of the project relatively low. We have thoroughly researched and worked with a very good professional vendor. The only risks will be manufacturing and shipping times, there are always events outside of our control (i.e. weather) that could delay in shipping. Our goal is to deliver the planners as soon as possible and kindly ask in advance is for patience and that backers respond to the information survey as quickly as possible.⇒ PLEASE NOTE: Please be aware that colours can vary from monitor to monitor and also from monitor to print. The inner page designs may vary slightly, and any updates will be notified immediately.We have taken the utmost care in compiling this book, however, we cannot accept responsibility for any errors or changes herein.⇒ PLEASE NOTE FOR INTERNATIONAL ORDERS - Import duties, taxes, and charges are not included in the item price or shipping cost. These charges are the buyer's responsibility. Please check with your country's customs office to determine these additional costs prior to purchasing. Ultimately, our aim is to make sure you are happy and receive your product on time. Any questions do not hesitate to message us.",28.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: 0,"
column3:
/>

Heat and sweat get in the way of everything, from your work life to your play life, from your job to your hobbies. If you want to stay comfortable and stay effective at everything you do, then you need to stay cool. Of course, staying cool is much easier said than done, especially during the dog days of summer. How do you do it? How do you do it conveniently? How do you do it easily?
column5: >Bad sweat odor bothers people
column7:
>Occasionally adjusting fan is not only tiring, but it also decreases work efficiency

Let’s admit it, we know the struggles like ones above. Working in scorching heat drains stamina, disturbs attention and produces a drenched smell. An outside environment without AC, and frequently adjusting fans is physically and mentally disturbing task.

Our solution is Windward, a hands-free wearable fan that you can take with you everywhere you go. Windward reduces the heat that you feel, making you more efficient and directing air flow from the front to the back of your body. It stays stable as you move around, so you can climb, jog, or run without ever worrying about knocking it out of place. You simply place Windward on your neck, and the our system will adjust the direction of the air for your comfort. It’s all based on the Coanda effect, and as you will see very quickly after you put it on, it works impressively well!

 

What Windward can provide?
column9:
>Windward stays around your neck,
and it will prevent sweating through lowering body temperature
column13: >Wind of Windward breezes along with the neck

column2:
>Wind speed is 1.8 m/s on top and bottom at the wind level 3

The air does not flow in a fixed direction, but it surrounds the entire neck, which allows cooling the heat in the back area. Even with sweat, Windward will quickly dry it off before germs can grow. Through equally distributing weight around the neck, we minimized possible discomfort.
column4: >Ergonomic design provides stability during movement
column7: >Pliable material allows easy wearing
column10: >Separable design allows you to carry it around in your bag
column12: >You can charge and use windward at the same time
column14:
> 

How it is designed?

 

 

How Windward operates?

We initially tried to make Dyson’s bladeless fan wearable on the neck. However, portable battery lacked efficiency to operate a fan with high-pressure wind.
Accordingly, instead of increasing the wind pressure, we found ways to increase speed and adjust the direction of the wind.
column15:
/>

Coanda effect suggests that fluid jet tends to stay attached to a convex surface. Based on this observation, we developed an open duct and designed a suitable propeller to maximize the effect.

Air from Windward flows on the surface of the open duct, even towards the back of the body without the high-pressure fluid flow.

 

 

When do you need Windward?
column18: >Working outside, using both hands for work
column20:
>Hiking

Recommended for those working outside/ environment without AC and those highly susceptible to heat. Anyone can use it depending on a situation.

 

 

Specification of Windward

 

 

Timeline

 

 

What We need &
column21:
What You Get

Currently, we are looking to put together $50,000 in start-up capital, which will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing Windward on a global scale. This is where we need your help, friends. The more funds that we raise through this campaign, the better we can position ourselves for the future, to continue to improve on the Windward model and even develop other innovations with your comfort in mind. To say thanks for your support, we are offering major discounts exclusively through this campaign.

 

 

Team Story

Hi. I am Taewoo. I had to spend substantial effort to develop Windward.
For nearly a year, I repeated designing the body and the duct of Windward and destroying them and tested tens and hundreds of propellers. I also faced unexpected difficulties while preparing for mass production.
column22:
>

The whole process was full of challenges, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Without generous help from many people, the birth of Windward would not have been possible. Really thanks to my friends, partnership company, South Korea government and my parents

I still have a long way to go, but I also believe in my potential. I will continue to grow as I have no matter what obstacles are ahead of me.

Your support will definitely be of great help.

 

 

Risk &
column23:
Challenge

There are two key areas in which we would like to improve Windward in future iterations: its sound level and its battery life. We believe that our prototype is ready for market, but the biggest challenges that we face are in research as we address these problems and come up with solutions that work.

As it is now, the device runs for about 8 hours. That is around the length of an average work day, but we know that we can do better given the proper time and resources. Likewise, the decibel level for the motors is acceptable, but it can be a nuisance in environments that are supposed to be quiet.

 

The Impact

Picture yourself going through each day of your life in total comfort, never worrying about sweat, never worrying about over-heating. We want to bring this picture to life, and we know that we can through the technology we have developed in Windward. Your contributions will bring this modern innovation to consumers worldwide.

 

Our Vision
column25:
>We aim to make the world full of joy and happiness

 

In order to achieve this goal to create the world a better place, the first thing was for ourselves to enjoy our work.

This is why we created WINDWARD to solve one of the biggest problems at work that many people have suffered from, which is “easily feeling the heat and sweating excessively while working in heat.”

If you are one of them who are suffered from sweating, we hope our windward, a great invention of the project we enjoyed, can refine the inconvenience of sweating.

Besides WINDWARD, as long as we continue to move forward step by step, we believe our inventions will contribute to create the world with full of joy and happiness that we dream of.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond making a monetary contribution, you can show your support for what we are doing by sharing a link to this campaign on any social media platforms you use. Spread the word about Windward and its potential impact on lives everywhere! Post about this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter! We appreciate all contributions, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.
column34: target=""_blank"">Press Kit
column43: '>
column52: >Please share your story in the comment section
column53:
>Your comment can have a huge effect on us.

 

e.g 1) Where would you like to use a windward? In your garage?

e.g 2) Is there a friend who you want to give this windward as a present?
The one who has strong body odor?

e.g 3) Have you been in danger due to the sweat in a rivulet while working in the heat?
Please share your story with us!

e.g 4) Which is the sweatiest part of your body?

column2:
>How many tools do you use to write a book?

There are tools for outlining, for managing timelines, for keeping a manuscript organized, for distributing the book to beta-readers, and making ARCs available. There are project management tools built for other types of work that we adapt the best we can to keep ourselves on track. An extensive story bible is often one big document, or in some detached platform where you still have to stop what you're doing to manage it. 

Productivity is on you, as an indie author. Fill out your calendar, set reminders on your phone, track your daily word counts in a note pad or on still another platform—if you remember. It seemed like such a good idea when you first signed up, after all.

Why is there not smart platform to manage all of this, made just for us?
column3: >With your help, there will be.
column5:
/>My name is Brian Palmer, I'm an author and ghostwriter with over sixty novels written and published. If there's a tool out there to make writing easier or faster, I've used it and run into the same frustrating limitations that you have. 

Whether that's the Eldritch Gateway of Microsoft Word, from which there is no return once my editor wants the manuscript in .docx format, or the full spread of open windows on my computer to manage the various aspects of a project across a jigsaw puzzle of apps and platforms, or the manual entries in my calendar to keep me on track and hitting my targets, or even the laborious task of opening up every ebook to update back matter and re-compile each one to be current... 

You get the picture. So much time is lost, so many words don't get written. When it comes to collaboration, it becomes a whole other even more complicated ball game. 

What if there was one platform that allowed us to plan our projects, outline our stories, write our books, manage our story bibles without getting in the way, even allow us to automate tasks like updating back matter or ebook styles, and gave us a virtual space to connect with collaborators and friends who can meet us where we work instead of requiring that we dance the import/export/upload/download cha-cha?
column6:
>Meet Scribi.

Scribi Writer's Studio has been in the works for close to three years, every feature painstakingly considered, workshopped, and planned around the indie author. Its core design principle: make life easier for writers. 

In Scribi, you'll be able to go from planning to publishing without ever leaving the platform, all while Scribi helps keep you organized and motivated to build your catalog. We've crafted a suite of smart tools that will cut the time you spend doing menial upkeep tasks to almost zero—and in some cases, all the way. It is, genuinely, the first full-featured smart platform for indie authors.
column7:
>See what it can do for you.

These wireframe demonstrations cover just a few of the features planned for Scribi the day we launch. This is by no means extensive, just some of the most exciting tools that will help us focus on what really matters: writing books. 

Scribi will organize your catalogs across multiple pen names, and allow you to do bulk updates to ebooks—from updating styles to keep your branding current, to updating front- and back-matter across multiple books using our book block system. You can customize your blocks—like a call to action for your newsletter—or use one of Scribi's dynamic blocks that can automate things like including a teaser chapter from the next book in your series. You'll be able to export individual books, update a whole series at once, and create box sets in a matter of seconds. 

Scribi will track your productivity, like how long it takes you to finish an outline, how many words you write per hour or per day on average, and use that information to make scheduling a new project not only a one-click process, but also realistic and based on how you actually work. When using a template schedule, you can pin critical dates or add and remove phases to refine your process, and Scribi will automatically make adjustments. The perfect balance of manual and automatic.
column8:
>

Scribi's flexible StoryBase system is integrated into every part of the platform. While you brainstorm, plot out your beats, outline, or write your manuscript you can create new characters or setting elements on the fly or link existing elements to any part of your story by tagging elements with the @ symbol as you type. As a result, you'll build up a story bible as you work and never lose track of anything, no matter how large your series gets. Invite collaborators like a co-author, and they'll have access to your StoryBase so that everything can be consistent. 

 

 

 

Our initial mobile app will make Scribi your new virtual writer's assistant, who knows how you work, helps you schedule your projects, and then keeps you updated and motivated to stick to your schedule and keep writing. As a small bonus, you'll be able to invite readers early on to download the app for free and follow you on Scribi to get news and notifications right on their devices when you have a new book up for ARCs, beta-reading invites, or when you release a new title to a retailer.

 

These features are just a few of the most exciting things Scribi can do to make our lives easier, and they're just in the first phase.

You'll be able to brainstorm, plan your beat sheet, outline, write, share and ultimately compile and update your books all in one place, and recreate a successful process with our project templates so that you can focus on what's most important: writing more books and growing your catalog.
column9:
>Future Growth and Development

We have a five phase plan for growth and expansion that has the potential to change our industry.

column1: • As we roll out and refine new features for the web-application, we'll deliver an app version for mobile devices that will help Scribi integrate even more deeply into the technology you use to manage your life. The same apps will deliver readers a premium experience with your books as beta-readers and reviewers.

• Once our platform is expanded and integrated, we'll provide a desktop version that can localize your work to take offline any time, which will deliver all the same features from the browser-based version, and sync with your Scribi account when you need to.

• Our next massive step will be our social platform designed to connect readers and authors like never before, allowing readers to get updates the moment an author they follow publishes a new book, form reader groups or join an author's fan club, and will help readers connect more easily to new-to-them authors in genres they love. All without the clutter of advertising and distractions endemic to the social media platforms that authors can't do without in this age.

• Our enterprise phase will provide more robust team-management tools for small publishers and allow editors, ghost writers, cover artists, and others to find work and even accept payment through the platform. As those roll out, we'll deploy store pages, so that your readers can first connect to your books on other platforms, and then even purchase them direct from Scribi to shorten the distance between discovery and clicking 'buy'. As we move into these stages, we'll eliminate subscriptions entirely for author-level users, and focus on supporting the platform through on-site sales and enterprise activity.
• We even have a plan for an Education platform that will allow educators everywhere to crowdsource literary and writing education, and help inspire generations of writers to come.
Ambitious? Very. But also very possible—and with our development partners, even likely.
column3:
>

To get Scribi built, I'm working with the folks at Brainhub, one of Poland's fastest growing software development companies who have seen stunning growth in just three years. They're on the cutting edge of application development, with 50+ brilliant consultants using the same technologies that run Facebook and Twitter, and have worked with Fortune 500 companies like National Geographic, Beam, and InPost just to name a few. They have just as much passion for this project as I do, and are perfectly positioned to bring us a beautiful, user-friendly, platform like Scribi.

With them, this project is in great hands.
column4:
>Risk and Challenges

Of course, it's not easy launching a whole platform. We're acutely aware that this is an industry where there are a lot of tools available to writers—in fact, it's the huge number of tools available that ultimately led us down this path. 

Part of how we're managing that risk is by crowdfunding this project. It's a market test that lets us see whether our community is interested in a tool like this, whether it's something that writers and in particular the indie authors really want. If we can get it funded, that's a yes! If not, then we know that now isn't the time, and that indies are happy to continue juggling apps to get the job done. 

We're confident that if we can bring Scribi to the market, it will be a game changer for writers. It will change the way we work, provide tools that we've never had before, with integration like we've never had before, and we aren't stopping at providing that set of tools. Our long term goals are ambitious, and represent the greatest challenge of all: completely changing the indie publishing industry. We have stiff competition. There are some giant companies out there built by people whose main job is to profit off of authors. And we've done great by those people! But there hasn't been a platform like this, yet, built by us, that can provide the things that we need. 

Take a moment to imagine publishing a book right on the Scribi platform, and being able to split test your front and back matter. Imagine checking your stats, and seeing that 60% of readers that pick up your book stop reading at around the 35% mark. Imagine a dashboard that can show you how your books stack up with other authors in your genre, how your genre is doing compared to other genres. Imagine being able to see that 84% of your readers also read these authors, and that you have X amount of audience overlap with this or that author. That your readers not only read Dystopian sci-fi but also seem to read a lot of romance. 

That's where we're headed. Into a new world of unprecedented insight into more than just how books get written, how catalogs get built. We want to open up the publishing market and provide the kind of insight and connection that is going to help authors write more books and then sell more books and connect with more readers. It has to start somewhere. And this is where it starts. 

We hope that you'll join us on the way there.

They have just as much passion for this project as I do, and are perfectly positioned to bring us a beautiful, user-friendly, platform like Scribi.With them, this project is in great hands. Risk and ChallengesOf course, it's not easy launching a whole platform. We're acutely aware that this is an industry where there are a lot of tools available to writers—in fact, it's the huge number of tools available that ultimately led us down this path. Part of how we're managing that risk is by crowdfunding this project. It's a market test that lets us see whether our community is interested in a tool like this, whether it's something that writers and in particular the indie authors really want. If we can get it funded, that's a yes! If not, then we know that now isn't the time, and that indies are happy to continue juggling apps to get the job done. We're confident that if we can bring Scribi to the market, it will be a game changer for writers. It will change the way we work, provide tools that we've never had before, with integration like we've never had before, and we aren't stopping at providing that set of tools. Our long term goals are ambitious, and represent the greatest challenge of all: completely changing the indie publishing industry. We have stiff competition. There are some giant companies out there built by people whose main job is to profit off of authors. And we've done great by those people! But there hasn't been a platform like this, yet, built by us, that can provide the things that we need. Take a moment to imagine publishing a book right on the Scribi platform, and being able to split test your front and back matter. Imagine checking your stats, and seeing that 60% of readers that pick up your book stop reading at around the 35% mark. Imagine a dashboard that can show you how your books stack up with other authors in your genre, how your genre is doing compared to other genres. Imagine being able to see that 84% of your readers also read these authors, and that you have X amount of audience overlap with this or that author. That your readers not only read Dystopian sci-fi but also seem to read a lot of romance. That's where we're headed. Into a new world of unprecedented insight into more than just how books get written, how catalogs get built. We want to open up the publishing market and provide the kind of insight and connection that is going to help authors write more books and then sell more books and connect with more readers. It has to start somewhere. And this is where it starts. We hope that you'll join us on the way there.",8.0,0,"1 Campaign

be described as an innovative inkjet printing utility targeting primary the business
sector and secondly the personal printing needs. Its ergonomical design, size
and cutting-edge technology make selfpree ideal replacement for business
stamps, labeling systems and in general, its applicability in printing

column2: >At the heart of the selfpree resides a robust and reliable printing head providing high-quality

column1: with reasonable printing resolution. Moreover, the ink is user-selected (color,
quality, cost) since the ink tank can be easily refiled. The printing head is
driven by high-performance, power-optimized microcontroller which
responsibility include also driving the motor of the printing head and
controlling the miscellaneous functions of the device. Selfpree facilitates an
E-Paper monitor displaying messages, its status and of course, the printing
screen (what will be printed). Up to 20 print-screens can be saved locally to
accommodate the multi-functional applications reducing the printing
responsiveness in such scenarios (multiple stamps). The power requirements are
managed by a durable Li-ion battery, rechargeable from a mini-USB connector. Printing
can be triggered easily by a dual-purpose button which is also used as ON/OFF
switch. The following figure provides an abstract view of system architecture
depicting the main components of selfpree.
accompanied by a user-friendly application running on Android, iOS and
Windows.  The application can be used to
create, delete, edit and send the printing-screens to selfpree as well as to
monitor and control the functions of the device. It could be connected using
BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) or the mini-USB connector with selfpree.

with reasonable printing resolution. Moreover, the ink is user-selected (color,

accommodate the multi-functional applications reducing the printing
responsiveness in such scenarios (multiple stamps). The power requirements are
